alert.note: Alert for Butler; Clarke; Conecuh; Covington; Crenshaw; Monroe; Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 15 at 9:02AM CDT until June 15 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Alabama and southwest Alabama, including the following counties, in south central Alabama, Butler, Conecuh, Covington, Crenshaw, Monroe and Wilcox. In southwest Alabama, Clarke. * WHEN...Until 1215 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 901 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenville, Thomasville, Luverne, Camden, Georgiana, Pine Hill, Brantley, McKenzie, Red Level, Rutledge, Beatrice, Dozier, Vredenburgh, Gantt, Glenwood, Yellow Bluff, Pine Apple, Petrey, Highland Home and Butler Springs.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Butler; Clarke; Conecuh; Covington; Crenshaw; Monroe; Wilcox
